text: Nitro tap at the Map Room. Chocolaty and dark bodied. Very creamy with a touch of cinnamon mocha and licorice. Smooth bodied and sweet finish.

Stout.   
ギネス的なま&

650ml bomber from Beer Bazaar, shared with brother-in-law Steve. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Nose has medium sweet flavor with dry chocolate, burnt sugars, burnt bread, quite ash-y. Medium bodied. Some dry, burnt malts to finish, light roast, dusty cocoa. Finishes dry and short. 13.7

On tap at Red Star Bar in Chicago -- This was on nitro and poured typical of a stout on Nitro. Creamy black with tan head. Aroma was roasty and a hint of sweetness. Flavor was very nice, didnt have that cloying sweetness many other stouts have on Nitro. Very well done.

This a great stout. Super chocolately and dark coffee flavored. Pours a dark black coffee flavor. Bitter finish. Had at begyle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours black with 3 fingers of dark tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and a hint of caramel. Taste is light bitter and light sweet, follows aroma. Full bodied with a thick, creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long, bitter coffee finish. Pretty darn good.

Aroma is dark malts, coffee, chocolate, fruit and a hint of citrus. The flavor is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, toffee, light citrus/tea, a hint of tobacco and a mix of acidity and tartness in the finish. Citrus in a stout is a bit of a curve ball, but it was pretty good.
Bomber sent to me from my bro... Pitch black pour with HUGE brown head..aroma is complicated, taste is ligyt milk chocolate, some light sugar, pretty good shiz

Bottle and served in tulip: Pour deep brown near opaque with a mostly lasting frothy head and okay lace. This brew is rather straight forward (as are most dry stouts) but does offer a nice array of flavors with roast, nuts, coffee, and resiny hops. Mikey Likey and that is not easy when your a not hiding behind dark fruits notes and big alcohol.

Black opaque color, steady brown head. Toasted, a bit ashy aroma. Medium-bodied. Toasted malty licorice, some hops in the finish. Clean stylish stout, not sweetish, but roasted licorice flavors.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 02.05.2013, tap @ Mikkeller Bar:
Lett sødmerik røsta lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, røsta korn og kaffi, puffaris, sjokolade, karamell, mørkt sukker. Frisk lett tørr og røsta smak med preg av mørk malt, humle, brent kaffi, røsta korn, karamell, våt papp, bitter sjokolade, litt chili. Middels bitterhet som set litt. Grei.

A misplaced, so very belated review noted during a pub crawl in Oak Park, IL. very early in the season.(late Feb.) Served to plastic by Matt on the outdoor patio of the Marion St. Cheese Market, so any expressive aroma & flavor notes were a bit diminished by the cold atmosphere, and subsequently, very cold beer. Displayed a black/brown color, with a modest layer of frothy, brownish tan head foam. The aroma was roasty, with some bakers chocolate, and a hint of burnt wood & smokiness. Medium bodied, with soft carbonation, the flavor contributed fair malt content, some mild astringency, and moderate, slightly earthy hop bitterness. A decent, even tempered Stout.

Pours dark, cloudy, and brown with a bubbly, tan head. Lightly roasty and semi-sweet aroma. Roasty, chocolate malt, biscuit, and light hop flavors. Nice stout, could also we considered a porter. Comparable to Founders Porter.
Poured from bottle from West Lakeview Liquors. Black with off white head. Off white floaties in the glass. Light carbonation aroma. Chocolate notes. Cream. Overall pretty light and easy drinking.
Dark brown pour, kahki head. Dry, roasty, peaty, slight sweetness. Huge dry roast flavor, sweet for the style but a very rich stout despite its gravity.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours hazy black with a frothy beige head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick trace on the glass. Smell is malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, moist soil, burnt wood, bitter chocolate, ash and hints of black pepper corns. Taste is bitter and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt wood, pine needles, lemon zest, ash and pumpernickel bread. Mouthfeel is dry, astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is bitter with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt wood and pine needles. Very drinkable...
Man, this one was really satisfying. Dark chocolate notes, roasted malt and a slightly sweet finish. Like drinking a campfire.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a dark brown black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma. Roasted malty coffee and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee and chocolate finish.

On tap @ Mikkeller. As good as black in the glass with a nice medium sized lacing ashy top. Smells light roasted, some chocolate, lots of milk chocolate actually and bitter burned coffee. Smells really nice. A little bit of vanilla also in here. Lovely flavors. Light burned, definitely heavy roasted, its not to dry, but definitely not to sweet either. About average on the carbonation with a light almost cloudy mouthfeel. Licorice lingering in the hoppy and roasted aftertaste. Nice stuff! 02.05.2013
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2015 From genes. Full roasted flavor but not overwhelmingly so.  Silky feel and quite chewy for the strength. Good stuff. Serving: bottle

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear dark brown colour with a average, creamy, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, burnt, chocolate, coffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, roasted, ash. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130501]

Keg @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. The pours deep brown with a small head. The nose is chocolate syrupy sweetness, some charred grain and toast. The taste is rich german chocolate cake. A bit of husk. Smooth toffee. Medium body, soft carbonation. Overall, solid.
[5/1/13] Draught at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Black.  Roasty aroma with some coffee beans. Roasty flavor, coffee-ish and pretty bitter.  Medium-bodied.

Keg at Mikkeller Bar - Copenhagen. Pours dark brown with a fine, tan cream head. Dusty cocoa in the nose, soft roast, earth. Medium sweet flavor with dry chocolate, burnt sugars, burnt bread, some dirt. Light to medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Some dry, burnt malts to finish, nice roast, dusty cocoa. Good, balanced stout.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours dark brown with a medium, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has lots of chocolate, Nutella, mild coffee. Low but prickly carbonation, fine creamy and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour has lots of chocolate and nuts. Quite dry in that way. Mild bitter finish. Good.
From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty. Bitter, dark malty and chocolate. Bitter and dark roasted malty. light and bitter, grapefruity finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar.
Pours black color with a small head. Aroma of rye, malts, chocolate and hops. Flavour of creamy malts, chocolate and rye. Nice.
4325

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen

Pours dark brown, almost black with a smooth head. Aroma of roasted malts, grainy notes and hints of coffee. Taste is smooth, grainy and malty with some roastiness. Finish is grainy with hints of coffee. Decent stout.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a black colour with a white head. Aroma is rather strong with notes of roasted malts, tar, leather and dark chocolate. Flavour of roasted malts, dark chocolate, biscuit, tar and licorice. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a dry, roasty, lingering bitter finish. Great stuff.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Dark brown coloured with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of hay and dark chocolate.
Roasted flavour of licorice with notes of hay and cocoa powder.
Roasted finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pitch black beer with a small beige head. Malty chocolate aroma, milky, vanilla notes, roasted, some ash, some cocoa powder. Hoppy chocolate flavor, soot, caramel, dark fruits, spicy notes, some vanilla. Decent but not outstanding beer, maybe a bit thin bodied.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Black - offwhite head. Coffee. Nice malty. Ok bitterness. Cocoa. Fruity. Nutty. Sweetness. Light herbal notes. Nice fresh coffee notes. Nice.
Draft at Mikkeller bar.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Aroma of cocoa, roasted malt, milk chocolate, light coffee.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
On tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours dark with a light brown head, aroma of coffee with a taste to match
nice despite not being impy. have to try more from them. it took me a while to get to this bottle, surprised this is only rating #2.

Tasted at restaurant, so this first tasting not as thorough as could be - black with fair, creamy, tan head / Dry, mild nose of toasted grain, roast coffee, cocoa / Medium body, dry, somewhat chewy, fine balance and bitter finish / Dry, smooth flavors of roast barley, dark roast coffee, caramel, and grass / Another fine, nicely balanced dry(er) stout from Begyle.
